intro: Saurauia pseudoscabra, commonly known as the rough-leaved saurauia, is a flowering plant native to Southeast Asia. It belongs to the family Ericaceae, which includes heathers and blueberries. The plant is characterized by its woody stems and simple, elliptical leaves with a rough, textured surface. Its small, white or pale pink flowers appear in clusters and bloom in the spring. Saurauia pseudoscabra is often found in moist, shaded forest environments, where it thrives in the understory.
